headline.main: World Briefing | Europe: Macedonia: Peace-Plan Election Delayed

lead_paragraph: The speaker of Parliament canceled a vote on dissolving the legislature, thereby postponing an election required under a peace accord with ethnic Albanian rebels. It had been due to be held on Jan. 27 under the agreeement, which pulled the former Yugoslav republic back from the brink of full-blown civil war, but Parliament must be dissolved two months before a general election. Most members opposed the January date because of delays in re-establishing govenment authority in rebel territory. President Boris Trajkovski, as well as officials of the peacekeeping mission led by the European Union and NATO, also favored putting off the election, citing April as a more realistic date.
